title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response cannot contain more than one layer as a response.

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one negative environmental effect in the area as a result of a decrease in precipitation.
descriptions: The response does not describe one of the following negative consequences.
The response describes one of the following negative consequences.

title: Part (b)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must describe, not just identify, how the geology in a watershed affects groundwater recharge.
descriptions: The response does not describe one of the following ways that geology affects groundwater recharge.
The response does not describe one of the following ways that geology affects groundwater recharge.

title: Part (b)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response can contain only one particle type.

title: Part (b)(iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe one characteristic of soil that would allow for maximum rate of recharge of the aquifer, such as:
The response describes one characteristic of soil that would allow for maximum rate of recharge of the aquifer, such as:

title: Part (c)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate the amount of soil collected in devices (at the end of each month) as the dependent variable.
The response indicates the amount of soil collected in devices (at the end of each month) as the dependent variable.

title: Part (c)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe Plot C as native/undisturbed forest used as a comparison.
The response describes Plot C as native/undisturbed forest used as a comparison.

title: Part (c)(iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe a practice or agricultural method that could be used at Plot B.
The response describes a practice or agricultural method that could be used at Plot B.

title: Part (c)(iv)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify one characteristic of the land surface in the plots that could be altered and does not describe how altering the characteristic could decrease the amount of erosion in both plots.

The response identifies one characteristic of the land surface in the plots that could be altered but does not describe how altering the characteristic could decrease the amount of erosion in both plots.
The response identifies one characteristic of the land surface in the plots that could be altered and describes how altering the characteristic could decrease the amount of erosion in both plots.
